availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of James M. Rice. Married to Adelaide Crabtree Rice in Lawrence County, Kentucky, on August 8, 1850. Father of Jane H. Rice, John C. Rice, James M. Rice, Elizabeth C. Rice, Mary M. Rice, Eureka Rice, and Jake Rice. Attorney in Lawrence County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned fourteen enslaved persons in Lawrence County in 1850. Attorney in Louisa, Lawrence County in 1860. Employed Sarah Scaggs as a house servant in Lawrence County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 76A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 663.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 266B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 10375.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Lawrence County Marriages, Film 007718459, p. 28.
